messages: 0f2a1e434bcc262e3022758bf7da282d (11:34): does anyone here know how I go about determining which WAP my machine is connected to if there are multiple WAP's with the same ssid?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:36): iwconfig should show the AP's mac address
0f2a1e434bcc262e3022758bf7da282d (11:38): thanks - i'll give that a shot
0f2a1e434bcc262e3022758bf7da282d (11:38): (if I can find it for OS X =)
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (11:42): azterix: ya know, specifying what OS you're using if you're not using linux, on irc, would be a smart thing to do *first*
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (11:42): when asking how to do something that's obviously OS specific
0f2a1e434bcc262e3022758bf7da282d (11:42): isn't OS X linux? =)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:43): oh the disappointment
0f2a1e434bcc262e3022758bf7da282d (11:43): i guess i was half-expecting there to be a *nix standard way of finding it
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (11:44): well.  i just watched The Neverending Story last night, so i do know the power of wishes.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:44): there is... you're just  lacking *nix.
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (11:44): but then.  tonight, I watched The Pianist.
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (11:44): J4k3: no he's not; he's got macos.  just that the term is virtually meaningless.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:44): *system error 11* [unhappy face]
0f2a1e434bcc262e3022758bf7da282d (11:45): now, now - i'm not the run-of-the mill mac pixel gypsy
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (11:45): J4k3: what are you up to tonight
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:45): dissing osx
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:45): otherwise playing with trixbox
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:45): the new version
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:49): super range 9
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:49): first you said it had a freq converter, then it didn't, now it does
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:49): oh yes i know the name
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:50): I don't actually own one to open it up, so what evidence is there either way?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:50): I opened mine up

a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:51): at first I figured it was a frequency converter, then ubnt eluded to it being a completely new radio chipset, then I got my hands on one and opened it up and found a converter inside.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:51): I didn't bother to take pics
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:51): my camera sucks
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:51): send one to me, I'll take pics ;-)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:51): get your own! :D
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:51): get two, they're fun
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:51): I'm thinking of them, but got too many arlans now
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:51): not to mention price is pretty high
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:52): sucks that it is a converter.. would you say ubnt lied to you?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:53): not really
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:53): the datasheet says the radio ic is their chip
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:53): self-designed?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:53): when in reality there is no chip inside that says "ubiquiti" anything
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:54): then you look at the layout
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:54): and you see a frequency converter housing
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:54): ah...  read how frequency converters work and you'll understand
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:55): its like... where the actual transition occurs
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:55): so do 2.4ghz decies nearby confuse the sr9?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:56): not that I've noticed so far, but I'm always sure to change the 2.4 device to ch11 to avoid potential interference
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:56): the cards usually can hear each other on 2.4
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:56): but usually not that badly (-80 or lower)
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:56): you mean 2.4 cards in the same case?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:57): I've noticed no reported crosstalk on ch11 / sr9
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:57): on the same sbc, yes
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:57): I'm sure its power/data bus rf leakage
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:57): how much does this vary b/w different companies' NICs
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:58): the louder the card, the more chance of crosstalk
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:58): thats what I've seen
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:58): it doesn't seem to be brand-specific
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (11:58): just power output specific
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:58): interesting
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:58): I'll read up on freq-converters... I need to
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:59): I still want to do my 900/2.4ghz to 24ghz transverter project
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (12:01): I had no idea the impedance of free space was 377 ohms
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (12:05): "only between your ears"!!
